questions: Q. 1. Name the two kingdoms of the living world proposed by Linnaeus.
answers: Ans. The two kingdoms of the living world proposed by Linnaeus are: Plantae and Animalia.

questions: Q. 2. Who introduced five kingdoms classification?
answers: Ans. R. H. Whittaker.

questions: Q. 3. What are eukaryotes?
answers: Ans. Organism in which cells have nuclear envelope around the genetic material are called eukaryotes.

questions: Q. 4. What are prokaryotes?
answers: Ans. Organism with cells devoid of a devoid of a definite nuclear membrane around the genetic material are prokaryotes.

questions: Q. 5. Name the scientist who suggested “three kingdom system of classification”.
answers: Ans. E. Haeckel suggested three kingdom system of classification.

questions: Q. 6. Name three major groups of Archaebacteria?
answers: Ans. The three major groups of Archaebacteria are: Methanogens, Halophiles, Thermoacidophiles.

questions: Q. 7. What are protists?
answers: Ans. Protists are eukaryotic unicellular organism.

questions: Q. 8. What are phytoplankton?
answers: Ans. These are microscopic, free-floating Photosynthetic organisms.

questions: Q. 9. In which kingdom are bacteria included?
answers: Ans. Kingdom Monera.

questions: Q. 10. Expand PPLO. What is its other name ?
answers: Ans. PPLO Means pleuropneumonia like organisms. Its other name is Mycoplasma.

questions: Q. 11. Name of the three major groups of protista.
answers: Ans. The Three major groups of Protista are:0 (i) Protistian algae, (ii) Slime Moulds, (iii) Protozoa.

questions: Q. 12. Name any one parasitic protist and a ciliate protist .
answers: Ans. Parasitic protist: Trypanosoma Ciliate protists: Paramoecium.

questions: Q. 13. Name the organism that causes amoebic dysentery.
answers: Ans. Entamoeba histolyitica causes amoebic dysentry.

questions: Q. 14. Which protozoan causes malaria?
answers: Ans. Plasmodium is a protozoan which causes malaria.

questions: Q. 15. Name the major groups of Monera.
answers: Ans. The major groups of Monera are: (i) Bacteria (ii) Archaebacteria (iii) Cyanobacteria.

questions: Q. 16. Name the bacteria which causes Typhoid, Tetanus, Cholera?
answers: Ans. (i) Typhoid – Salmonella typhi (ii) Tetanus – Clostridium tetani (iii) Cholera – Vibrio cholerae

questions: Q. 17. Name the cell wall material of eubacteria.
answers: Ans. Murein or peptidoglycan consisting of polysaccharide cross-linked with short amino acid chains.

questions: Q. 18. Name the pigments present in photosynthetic bacteria.
answers: Ans. The pigments present in photosynthetic bacteria

questions: Q. 19. What are heterocysts?
answers: Ans. The filamentous blue-green algae possess special large sized cells called heterocysts. These are the sites of nitrogen fixation.

questions: Q. 20. What are trichomes?
answers: Ans. Each filament of blue-green algae consist of a sheath of mucilage and one or more cellular strands called trichomes.

questions: Q. 21. Name the pigments present in cyanobacteria.
answers: Ans. The pigments present in cyanobacteria are: Chlorophyll 'a', phycobilin, phycoerythrin and phycocyanin.

questions: Q. 22. What are hormogonia?
answers: Ans. Blue-green algae multiply asexually by the formation of small segments called hormogonia.

questions: Q. 23. What do you mean by plasmodium?
answers: Ans. A multinucleate mass of protoplasm of slime moulds which creep like Amoeba is known as plasmodium.

questions: Q. 24. Give two examples of archaebacteria?
answers: Ans. Methanogens and thermoacidophiles.
